intro: Hymenidium sikkimense, commonly known as the Sikkim hymenidium, is a rare flowering plant native to the Himalayan region. It belongs to the family Rhoipteleaceae and is characterized by its unique, palmate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Its botanical features include a woody stem and elliptical, leathery leaves with a glossy surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for botanical research and conservation efforts.
